contentList.content: Bloodletter focuses on anatomical and surgical knowledge, excelling in causing and exploiting bleeding effects and utilizing blood surfaces.
Blood Essence fuels the Bloodletter's surgical and bleeding-inflicting skills, serving as the vital source of precision and lethality.
Traverses to any available blood surface. This movement can`t be executed when <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FLANKED">Threatened</LSTag>.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on attack rolls when your target is bleeding and gain <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with Medicine.
With your autopsy and anatomical expertise, dissect eyes from the body.
With your autopsy and anatomical expertise, dissect brain from the body.
With your autopsy and anatomical expertise, dissect larynx from the body.
Throws a blood jar onto a surface, forming a blood surface. Creatures within this space become wet and are covered in filthy blood, preventing healing for 1 turn.

Intentionally draws blood. If the target is hostile, inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">Bleeding</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SEVERE_BLEEDING_BLOODLETTER">Severe Bleeding</LSTag>. Otherwise, purges the target from disease, poison, paralysis or blindness and heals.
Stepping into a blood surface heals the Bloodletter, amount equal to <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Following a successful sneak attack, you seamlessly transition into a melee strike potentially causing <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">Bleed</LSTag> and deals [1]

Selecting a target humanoid or undead, you execute precise dissection and deals [1]. This is considered a sneak attack.
Declares the impending demise of a wounded target with less than 50% health.
On Miss : Does not spend Blood Essence
On a successful Saving Throw, target still take half damage.

Takes [1] at the start of each turn and has Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

Removed by healing.
Marks any foes that come into contact with blood puddles, potentially revealing the presence of invisible foes. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on attack rolls.
This creature is standing on a blood surface and being traced.

Corrupts blood puddles, deals [1] on any foes standing on blood surfaces and applies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISON_BLOOD_CORRUPTION_BLOODLETTER">Corrupted Blood</LSTag>. Targets with the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">Bleeding</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SEVERE_BLEEDING_BLOODLETTER">Severe Bleeding</LSTag> status suffer an additional [2]
Upon landing a successful attack on a full-health enemy, the Bloodletter splatters blood, creating a blood surface at the point of impact.

Prevented from <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Fire damage but <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Lightning and Cold damage. Cannot be healed.
Sacrifice half of your current hit points and enter Vital Surge status.
Harvest blood from the surface, restoring hit points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> whenever you step onto a blood surface.
Gain an extra <LSTag Tooltip="Action">action</LSTag>. When landing a killing blow, regain 1 blood essence, and heals you.
